title: REITs Rally As Dividend Growth Wave Continues
text: U.S. equity markets rallied to fresh record-highs after muted inflation data temporarily curbed concerns about an "overheating" economy ahead of the deployment of another massive round of stimulus. The "reopening trade" gave way to the "American exceptionalism" trade this week as domestic-focused, pro-cyclical segments of the equity market - notably Mid-Caps and Small-Caps - surged this past week.

title: Crude to $100: Trader makes the case for a spike in oil prices
text: Rising crude oil prices should benefit several key energy stocks, two traders say.

title: Binance Under Investigation By Commodity Futures Trading Commission Over Derivatives Activity: Report
text: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is reportedly investigating the major cryptocurrency exchange Binance. What Happened: The commission is looking into whether U.S. residents have traded derivatives that Binance monitors, Bloomberg reported yesterday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Week Ahead: Rising Treasury Yields Will Make This An Interesting FOMC Decision
text: The bond market seems determined to make this an interesting FOMC policy decision. Treasury yields have been surging after the Biden administration passed the $1.9 trillion COVID relief bill and set a May 1st goal of getting vaccines to all adults.

title: Market Snapshot: Markets set up for disappointment from Fed meeting as bond yields renew rise
text: All eyes will be on the Federal Reserve's meeting next week as traders put pressure on the central bank to prevent a de-stabilizing rise in bond yields.

title: Why the spiking bond yields driving sharp losses in tech stocks are not a long-term threat to the market, according to one Wall Street chief strategist
text: A spike in interest rates since the start of the year has accelerated a rotation out of high-growth technology stocks and into value stocks poised to benefit from a reopening of the economy.  The Nasdaq has fallen more than 10% over the past month as the Dow has soared to record highs, with a spike in the 10-year US Treasury yield acting as the main catalyst. It recently surged to a cycle high of more than 1.60% after starting the year below 1%.

title: FA Center: Why inflation makes holding bonds for the long run riskier than owning stocks
text: You'd have to hold U.S. Treasury bonds for 57 years to not lose to inflation.

title: Vaccinations And Stimulus Boost Consumer Sentiment In Early March
text: The preliminary March results from the University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers show overall consumer sentiment rose in early March, hitting the highest level in a year. Ongoing distribution of vaccines as well as expectations for stimulus were the primary drivers.

title: Overlooked corner of stock market offers protection from bond-market volatility
text: The defensive utilities and consumer staples sectors could provide protection to stock-market investors wary of rising bond yields and the return of inflation that has been lacking since the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Buy the Bounce… in Interest Rates
text: By Robert Ross The Nasdaq entered correction territory after its 10.1% slide in the last month. Of course, the tech-heavy index bounced out of correction mode almost as soon as it entered it.

title: Could The U.S. Economy Grow By 7% This Year?
text: U.S. GDP growth forecast for 2021. ECB announces increase to pace of bond purchases.

title: I Used to Worry About Stock Market Crashes. Here's Why I Don't Anymore
text: With the right approach to saving and investing, you, too, can breeze through a stock market crash without losing sleep.

title: Money Makes The World Go 'Round
text: We are already in a global economic recovery. We have our arms around the coronavirus, openings have accelerated, and business is picking up quickly, including those industries most hurt, like airlines and hospitality.

title: Risk-Seeking Drives Yields Higher Only Until Risky Markets Croak
text: With the US 10-year Treasury yield pushing through 1.62 today, bond prices are in retreat and the yield back to where it was in early February 2020. How much further yields rise matters for all markets.

title: The European Central Bank Responds To Rising U.S. Interest Rates
text: The European Central Bank is reacting to rising interest rates in the world, particularly in the United States, by stepping up to increase security purchases. The eurozone and other countries in the world are out of sync with the United States in terms of achieving economic recovery, and this is pushing government policy makers to edge.

title: The Week On Wall Street: New Highs Across The Board
text: The short-term picture revolves around interest rates. This too shall pass. As the Secular Bull market continues, the next leg higher will be driven by earnings.

title: Weekly High Frequency Indicators: 2021 Is Shaping Up To Be Awesome
text: High frequency indicators can give us a nearly up-to-the-moment view of the economy. The metrics are divided into long leading, short leading, and coincident indicators.
